meanings.definition: A person who is an expert in the study or development of methods.
meanings.sent1: The methodologists conducted research to improve teaching techniques.
meanings.sent2: The methodologists gathered to discuss the best approach for data analysis.
meanings.sent3: The methodologists joked about creating a new way to organize their office supplies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of problem-solving, methodologists are the architects of efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The methodologists' dedication to refining processes is truly admirable.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who specialize in the systematic study of methods.
meanings.sent1: Methodologists from different fields collaborated on a project to streamline procedures.
meanings.sent2: The methodologists presented their findings at the conference on research methodologies.
meanings.sent3: During the team-building exercise, the methodologists showcased their unique problem-solving skills.
meanings.sent4: The methodologists, like detectives, meticulously unravel complex systems to find solutions.
meanings.sent5: The methodologists' expertise in methodical analysis is unmatched.
